unnormalised: The heartburn started subtly, you know? Just a little discomfort after eating my mother’s aloo parathas. Maa always said, "Thoda ghee toh lagega, beta!" But soon, that "thoda" became a torment. I, Rakesh Kumar, a software engineer from Bangalore, thought it was just stress from work. Ignoring it, popping the occasional Gelusil, life went on.

unnormalised: Then came the bloating. Post lunch, I'd feel like I’d swallowed a football. My GP, Dr. Sharma, initially suspected acidity and prescribed Pantoprazole 40mg, once daily. It helped for a bit. But the nagging pain in my abdomen wouldn’t completely disappear. Googling (dangerous, I know!) led me down a rabbit hole of scary diseases. Colon cancer, Crohn’s… the works. My anxiety skyrocketed.

unnormalised: Finally, on 12/07/2024, after a particularly bad night where I couldn't sleep due to the pain, my wife, Priya, dragged me to a gastroenterologist at Manipal Hospital. Turns out, Dr. Reddy suspected something more than just acidity. He ordered a bunch of tests: blood work, stool sample, and, scariest of all, an endoscopy. The thought of a tube going down my throat… shiver!
normalised: Finally, on twelfth july two thousand and twenty four, after a particularly bad night where I couldn't sleep due to the pain, my wife, Priya, dragged me to a gastroenterologist at Manipal Hospital. Turns out, Doctor Reddy suspected something more than just acidity. He ordered a bunch of tests: blood work, stool sample, and, scariest of all, an endoscopy. The thought of a tube going down my throat… shiver!

unnormalised: The diagnosis? H. pylori infection. Apparently, quite common, but left untreated, it can lead to ulcers and even stomach cancer. Dr. Reddy prescribed a cocktail of antibiotics and antacids. Clarithromycin 500mg twice a day, Amoxicillin 1g twice a day, and Omeprazole 20mg once a day, for 14 days. Plus, dietary changes – no more spicy food, less chai, and smaller portions.
normalised: The diagnosis? H. pylori infection. Apparently, quite common, but left untreated, it can lead to ulcers and even stomach cancer. Doctor Reddy prescribed a cocktail of antibiotics and antacids. Clarithromycin five hundred milligram twice a day, Amoxicillin one gram twice a day, and Omeprazole twenty milligram once a day, for fourteen days. Plus, dietary changes – no more spicy food, less chai, and smaller portions.

unnormalised: It’s been a month now. The pain is mostly gone. The bloating is significantly reduced. I’m still avoiding Maa’s aloo parathas (she's not happy!), but I’m also grateful to have caught this early. Ignoring the symptoms was foolish. So, lesson learned: listen to your body, and don't delay seeing a specialist, especially if your stomach is acting up. It could be something as simple as H. pylori, but best to get it checked. Now, if you’ll excuse me, it's almost 8 PM, time for my medication.
